info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 21 at 8:11PM CDT until April 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN FORD...NORTHWESTERN KIOWA...SOUTHWESTERN PAWNEE AND EDWARDS COUNTIES... At 810 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Windhorst, moving northeast at 30 mph. A second severe thunderstorm is located 4 miles north of Kinsley moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Offerle, Kinsley and Garfield. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
